attributes.short_header: Due to the Simon Company's Copley Place construction, Back Bay Stations Dartmouth St underpass will remain closed until February 28, 2017
attributes.header: Due to the Simon Company's Copley Place construction, Back Bay Stations Dartmouth Street underpass will remain closed until February 28, 2017.
attributes.description:
Due to Copley Place construction being performed by the Simon Company, the Dartmouth Street underpass  leading to and from the west side of Dartmouth Street at Back Bay Station will be temporarily closed until February 28, 2017.

Customers are encouraged to use the stations main entrance on the east side of Dartmouth Street during the underpass closure. 

Affected routes:
Orange Line
Framingham/Worcester Line
Needham Line
Franklin Line
Providence/Stoughton Line

attributes.short_header: Shuttle buses & Rt. 39 service will replace Green Ln on all branches from Blandford, Northeastern, & Kenmore Stations to Arlington Sta from
attributes.header: Shuttle buses and Route 39 service will replace Green Line service on all branches from Blandford, Northeastern, and Kenmore Stations to Arlington Station from 9:00 pm on Saturday, December 17, to 12:00 pm on Sunday, December 18.
attributes.description:
Due to track work, shuttle buses will replace trains on the Green Line beginning at 9:00 pm on Saturday, December 17, with service resuming at approximately 12:00 pm on Sunday, December 18.  Shuttle buses will replace service between the following stations on the following branches:
 
B branch between Arlington and Blandford Street Stations 
C branch between Arlington and Kenmore Stations
D branch between Arlington and Kenmore Stations

Shuttle buses will make all station stops between Arlington and Kenmore/Blandford Stations.
 
*For E branch service between Arlington and Northeastern Stations, please utilize the Route 39 bus service. Connections can be made at Copley Station or Back Bay Station by traveling to St. James Ave and Dartmouth Street.
 
All stops are accessible for persons with disabilities.

If boarding, travel one-tenth of a mile down Haverhill Street to the entrance located at the intersection of Haverhill Street and Valenti Way.

attributes.short_header: Please board all trains on the inbound platforms at Haverhill & Bradford except Trains 216 & 222
attributes.header: Please board all trains on the inbound platforms at Haverhill and Bradford except Trains 216 (1:35 pm from Haverhill) and 222 (6:09 pm from Haverhill).
attributes.description:
Due to the Merrimack River Bridge project, trains that operate between Bradford and Haverhill will only use the inbound track. Trains that are bused between Haverhill and Bradford will board on the outbound platform at Bradford for service into Boston. 

Note: Train 216 (1:35 pm from Haverhill) and Train 222 (6:09 pm from Haverhill) are bused from Haverhill Station to Bradford Station.

The outbound platform at Bradford may be accessed via the crossing that is south (to the right when facing the tracks from the parking lot) of the mini-high platforms. Alternatively, the outbound platform can also be accessed via the sidewalk from Laurel Avenue. 

Affected stops:
Bradford
Haverhill

attributes.short_header: Buses will replace Red Line between Braintree and Quincy Adams Stations during the weekend of Dec 17 and 18 from start to end of service
attributes.header: Buses will replace Red Line service between Braintree and Quincy Adams Stations during the weekend of December 17 and 18 from start to end of service.
attributes.description:
Due to the Winter Resiliency Improvement Program, buses will replace Red Line trains between Braintree and Quincy Adams Stations in both directions from start to end of service on Saturday, December 17, and Sunday, December 18. 

Regular Red Line train service will resume at the start of service on Monday, December 19.

All shuttle bus stops are accessible for persons with disabilities

Shuttling the following stops:
Quincy Adams
Braintree

attributes.header: Shuttle buses replacing Green Line D branch service in both directions between Reservoir and Newton Highlands Stations due to a downed tree on the overhead wire at Newton Centre.
attributes.description:

Reservoir
Chestnut Hill (shuttle buses picking up on Hammond St and Route 9)
Newton Centre
Newton Highlands

attributes.short_header: Elevator 804 PARK STREET - Tremont Street to the Lobby will be reconstructed and will be out of service through June 2017.
attributes.header: Elevator 804 PARK STREET - Tremont Street to the Lobby will be reconstructed and will be out of service through June 2017.
attributes.description: If entering the station, cross Tremont Street to the Boston Common and use Park Street Elevator 978 to the Green Line westbound platform. Red Line platform access is available via the elevator beyond the fare gates. If exiting the station, please travel down the Winter Street Concourse toward Downtown Crossing Station, exit through the fare gates, and take Downtown Crossing Elevator 892 to the street level.

attributes.short_header: Elevator 861 CENTRAL - Ashmont/Braintree Platform to Street unavailable due to maintenance
attributes.header: Elevator 861 CENTRAL - Ashmont/Braintree Platform to Street unavailable due to maintenance
attributes.description: If exiting at Central Square, exit the Red Line at Harvard Square and take the Route 1 bus service to Central Square. Alternatively, exit at Kendall, take an Alewife-bound train to Central Square, and exit using Central Square Elevator 860. If boarding at Central Square, cross the street and take Elevator 860 to the Alewife-bound platform. Take the Red Line to Harvard Square and switch to an Ashmont-/Braintree-bound train.
